item.subtitle: The item(s) from the stimuli file
item.text: Specify here which row(s) you want to refer to in the stimuli sheet. If you want to refer to just one row, just write the row number. If you want to refer to multiple rows, write to, e.g. '2 to 5'. You should also be able to use commas, e.g. '2,3,5'.

code.subtitle: Name of the code file for this trial
code.text: Using the Code editor above you can create files that control what happens during each trial. You can either write web-code or use the graphic (user interface; GUI) editor to create your code.

description.subtitle: Deprecated
description.text: Please change this column header to name.

freq.subtitle: Deprecated
freq.text: Please change this column header to Weight.

frequency.subtitle: Deprecated
frequency.text: Please change this column header to Weight.

phase.subtitle: Deprecated
phase.text: Please change this column header to phasetype.

max_time.subtitle: In Seconds
max_time.text: User will leave the trial going as long as it takes the participant to complete it. You can specify a time limit in seconds though. Be careful when specifying this. This will start from when the trial is presented to the participant. Unless you are presenting a very simple trial, you may want to use a Phase.start_timer() within the trialtype code in the experiment.

no_progress.subtitle: Allows you to hide the progress bar from a trial row
no_progress.text: Simply include 'yes' in the rows that you do not wish the progress bar to be displayed and it will be hidden from the particpant. If you wish to hide it across the entire experiment please use the main Conditions table.

notes.subtitle: Just for you
notes.text: This doesn't do anything in the experiment, but you might find it useful for adding any notes you need for each task in your study. You can actually access this column within your phasetype code using {{notes}}

repeat.subtitle: Deprecated
repeat.text: Please change this column header to Weight.

phasetype.subtitle: Which PhaseType is required
phasetype.text: Enter the name (or select using the dropdown menu) the required phasetype task required.

shuffle_1.subtitle: Randomise trial order (within block)
shuffle_1.text: If you would like some trials shuffled together, write the same word next to the trials you want randomised together. For example, if I wanted the practice trials shuffled together, then I would write the word 'practice' in this column next to each of the practice trials. If you require between block shuffling, add a 'shuffle_2' column

shuffle_2.subtitle: Randomise trial order (between block)
shuffle_2.text: If you would like a group of trials shuffled together, write the same word next to the group of trials you want randomised together. For example, if I wanted to randomise whether a participant completed tasks 1-3 or 4-6 first, I would write 'TasksA' next to tasks 1-3 and 'TasksB' next to tasks 4-6 in this column. If you require within block shuffling, use the 'shuffle_2' column

text.subtitle: Mainly for instruct trialtypes
text.text: You can refer to this in any trialtype with {{text}}, but typically this is what you would want presented using instruct code.

timer_style.subtitle: How do you want the timer to look?
timer_style.text: You might want to hide the timer with 'display:none;' or change the style of the timer using other css rules

weight.subtitle: How many repetitions?
weight.text: Weight (or freq or frequency or repeat) sets how many occurrences of a trial you will have. By default, you will only have one occurrence of a unique trial (see Item for how to refer to multiple rows in the stimuli sheet). If you set the weight to 2, then you would have twice as many occurrences of the trial(s) as normal. If you set the weight to 0, then you will skip that row in the procedure sheet. This can be useful for piloting parts of your task.
